value: enjoys a Mediterranean climate, with dry summers and wet winters.

Lakewood is a bedroom community and one of the first large-scale tract housing cities built following WWII.  Lakewood is officially recognized as a Tree City USA by the National Arbor Day Foundation for its numerous trees and its active care for them.  Lakewood is also designated as Sportstown USA by
magazine for its 10 major parks, nine of which have fields, two community swimming pools and two community centers.

Lakewood is near the junction of California Freeway 91 and Interstate 605.  Exiting the 605 at Del Amo Blvd. or South Street then going west will lead to Lakewood.  Exiting the 91 at Lakewood, Clark or Bellflower Boulevards then going south will also lead into Lakewood.

content=Aside from the standard mall stores, Lakewood Center has a Carousel inside of the mall and a Pacific Movie Theatre with 16 screens, including one of the largest Southern California movie screens outside of Hollywood.

Being a bedroom community, Lakewood has very little in the way of lodging with only two motels located near the Long Beach Towne Center.  Some of the communities around Lakewood, especially

value: content=Located directly across from the Long Beach Towne Center, providing easy access to food, shopping and entertainment.
content=Located a short walk from the Long Beach Towne Center, providing easy access to food, shopping and entertainment.
For all emergencies in Lakewood, dial 911

The majority of Lakewood is considered safe.  Most crime in Lakewood is either domestic in nature or is burglary.  As at any major shopping center, shoppers at Lakewood Center should be careful about leaving valuables in their cars.

value: services Lakewood.  All three of the stations in Lakewood have firefighters trained in basic life support on duty.
